wp:category.wp:category_description: Some notable software development projects I have worked on

item.title: Toronto Based Software Consultant and eLearning Instructor
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded:
Welcome! I am Boris Misljencevic, a computer engineer by training who specializes in software consulting and instructing eLearning courses. I work remotely from both Toronto and Ottawa, Canada on a contract basis and have worked with clients from small startups to large multinational corporations. I offer free in person, Skype or phone consultations regarding my services. I hold a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from Carleton University in Ottawa Canada and have work experience with founding successful product startups such as Episync as well as multiple years of software design and development experience in large silicon valley based tech companies. Over the past three years I have transitioned to working as an independent software consultant and E-learning technology instructor. My technical experience lies with hot technologies such as: Cloud Engineering (Openstack, Azure, Amazon EC2), Big Data (Hadoop, Google Cloud Platform), RabbitMQ, SQL/PostgreSQL, Performance Engineering, Web Apps (Django, Javascript, HTML/CSS). I also specialize in various programming languages such as: Python, Java, C/C++ and JavaScript. For some examples of the work I do please look at my projects page or check out my GitHub account. If you are interested in setting up a free consultation please either fill out the form below or send me an email.
Fill This Form out for a Free Consultation

item.title: Django Estimates Free Trades Estimates
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_42" align="alignleft" width="300"] Django Estimates[/caption] Django Estimates is a web platform created to solve a problem in the trades contractor community. It was started when a friend of mine who is a painter was complaining about all the driving he had to do to go and do in person house painting estimates. I pitched him the idea that if he had his own website where his customers can get personalized painting estimates based on a form they fill in it will save him a lot of time and his productivity will skyrocket. When designing Django Estimates I decided to make it a platform which would support multiple types of contractor estimates (painting, cleaning, flooring, roofing) while also supporting multiple contracting companies in providing them a custom admin area where they can manage their prices, appointments and client engagements. The customers would have the option to book work immediately after receiving an estimates and they would get scheduled in the contractor's calendar. All parties would receive emails to confirm the appointments and estimate costs. When designing the platform I choose Django with a Mezzanine CMS as it already had a good admin interface standard. For the framework I picked Django because it was based on the easy to use python programming language which I knew well and it was easy to prototype and had a clean structure. The Mezzanine CMS allowed logged in users such as contractors to easily set their prices and manage their clients without needing to know the technical details going on in the background. Once rolled out and marketed, the Django web platform started generating up to 20 estimates a day and my friend the painter had a lot more work on his hands with a lot less driving time and gas spent on doing free in person estimates. For more on the Django Estimates app and to obtain the open source code please visit: https://github.com/bmisljen/djangoestimates

item.title: Canuck Aviation Website
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_57" align="alignleft" width="300"] Canuck Aviation Website[/caption] One of my passions is aviation and I hold a commercial pilot license and a flight instructor rating. I have created a website about flight training and how to become a pilot using the Wordpress CMS hosted on a shared Bluehost web server. The website was created with a Customizr free Wordpress theme and has integration with Google Adsense, Google Analytics, Webmaster tools as well as being registered on the Amazon Affiliates program.  The website runs of a customized child theme and utilizes various plugins for SEO, caching, photographic albums, picture and video compression, spam blockers and much more.  So far it has been a fun project and the traffic rates keep increasing every month. The website is available at: http://canuckaviation.com/

item.title: Python Easy Gui Email Flight Tracker
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_102" align="alignleft" width="300"] Python Easy GUI Flight Tracker App[/caption] Recently, I have been designing a Python based Easy GUI email app to send  daily flight tracker information to a list of emails. The application is an easy to use Windows .exe file that uses an Easy GUI graphic user interface to prompt users to enter their email settings (email address and password) followed by a list of send too emails separated by ";". Once this information is entered, the app continues on to prompt the user to enter daily flight logs for each flight flown including fields such as:  Aircraft Registration, Hobbs Start, Hobbs Stop, Time Up, Time Down, Air Time, Flight Time, TTSN.  After the user enters this information, the app formats the data into a nice looking HTML template and emails it out to the list of emails to send too. This simple app saves a lot of time for a repetitive daily task such as sending daily update emails to a list of people. The use of this app can be extended to match any automatic template generation and email sending needs. The app and the source code is available free of charge on Github: https://github.com/bmisljen/Python-Easy-Gui-Email-App

item.title: C++ Common Interview Questions
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: I have developed a public GitHub repo containing some of the most common C++ interview questions I have compiled throughout my studying for a series of interviews last year. The C++ project developed in the CodeLite IDE contains interview questions on: Fibinocci Sequence (iterative and recursive formulas), Linked Lists (add, remove, pop, peek, list, reverse list), String Operations (reverse string, print string characters, check if a string is an anagram), Binary Trees (insert, search, destroy, print BFS, print DFS), Number Operations (LCD, GCD) , Sorting (quick, insertion, bubble sort), Double Linked Lists (add, remove, pop, peek, list, reverse list) and  Objects and Polymorphism. It runs in an easy to use menu and is completely extendable.   For more on this project please visit the GitHub repo at: https://github.com/bmisljen/interviews

item.title: Ottawa's Real Estate Agent Website
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_64" align="alignleft" width="300"] ottawasrealestateagent.com[/caption] Some of my most common jobs are for professionals with their own businesses such as: doctors, lawyers, contractors and real estate agents. I usually always recommend a customized Wordpress site for these professionals because it enables them to modify the content of their website and add posts and pages as much as they desire. One advantage of using Wordpress as a CMS is the vast quantity of plugins available from everything from spam blocking to caching. Another is the massive amount of excellent themes available for free or for purchase. I recently designed and developed a real estate agent's website to increase her marketing and client outreach. For the design I had decided to go with the Real Homes Wordpress theme available for $59 at Theme Forest. This theme has  features such as: advanced properties search, Google map with properties markers, Various templates to display properties with customizable options, Front end property submit & edit, Payment integration with PayPal and much more. After picking the theme, I brought on my friend who was a graphical designer to edit all the real estate agent's photos and to format them for the various sizes required for the front page slider and the property listings area. With all this done I created various pages such as: About, Buyers, Sellers, Property Search, Testimonial and a news blog for the agent to post real estate updates to her clients. With all the necessary plugins installed (SEO, caching, security, etc...) some php updates to the theme added some desired cutomization. After some marketing with FaceBook and Google Adwords the end result was a great website which increased client interaction and satisfaction leading to more clients contacting the agent looking to buy and sell houses. The website is available here: http://ottawasrealestateagent.com/

item.title: Episync Wifi File Transfer App
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_68" align="alignleft" width="220"] Episync[/caption] Episync is an Android and PC (Mac, Linux, Windows) file transfer and syncing app that was created by myself (Boris Misljencevic) and a fellow student while studying engineering at Carleton University. The idea for the app came about when my phone USB port was broken and was not recognizing my computer when I wanted to transfer files between devices. I realized that the optimal solution to this problem was to implement a wireless transfer between phone and PC.  This would not only fix my problem, but it would also allow me to not carry my phone cable everywhere I go in order to transfer and sync files. When designing the app we chose to use Wifi as our medium of transfer between devices as it was easy and readily available to most all people. With the basic architecture set in place we decided to make the PC app a multi-threaded Java application using Swing for the GUI components as it was cross platform compatible. The app was to be made for Android first and then iOS second. We started off with a one folder PC to phone and phone to PC file transfer and sync and then we gradually improved the app to support multiple directories and files at the same time. Towards the end of our graduating school year we applied to a startup incubator and received funding for our idea from an angel investor associated with Carleton University in Ottawa Canada. We spent one summer developing Episync further and pitching it to clients and investors. We are still developing the app at the moment and watching it grow and acquire a larger user base as it matures. Overall Episync was a great learning experience as we improved our software design and development skills while learning how to start a business from the ground up. We learned how to create and market business plans as well as how to pitch our idea and execute technical demonstrations to potential customers. For more on the Episync app and for a free download please visit: http://episync.io/ News release available here: http://www.ottawacommunitynews.com/news-story/6238579-carleton-grads-develop-wire-free-file-sharing-app/

item.title: How to Create an Online Presence for your Business
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: In today's modern and connected world it is more important than ever to create a strong online presence for your business in order to attract and retain customers and increase revenues and sales. How to create a strong online presence ? That's where I can help by giving you a completely free consultation to get the ball rolling. In this post I will detail some of the key ways your business can expand its online presence and why they are important. 1. Create a Company Website With a Strong Mobile Theme It goes without saying that a good company website not only helps you  communicate your businesses message to your potential customers but also helps retain existing customers by giving them useful information. In today's world  there are plenty of CMS (Content Management Systems) such as Wordpress to choose from which allow someone to modify and add to a website with no technical knowledge. Best of all, these websites are easy and cheap to set up (I do them for as little as $200) and they look slick and perform well too. A blog section is important in a businesses website because this is the area where you will want to post about on going and up and coming events and special offers to engage your customers and keep them current. With smartphones and tablets dominating today's world it is critical to have a good mobile presence for your website. Luckily, most major CMS platforms such as Wordpress already support mobile themes. For a more custom high performance website, a special, high speed mobile theme can be implemented at an additional cost. 2. Social Media Presence Social media such as: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, Snapchat, Youtube and so on help you communicate your business brand to your customers. I recommend setting up pages and channels with all of these services and updating them regularly. I can also help with social media as an add on to my website services for a small additional fee. Best of all, social media can be linked to your website so that prospective clients can discover your website more easily! 3. Online Marketing and Advertising So you finally have this great business website and nice social media pages set up but no one knows about your business! This is a common problem that hits all startup business owners and aside from going out and pitching your business in person, it can also be done online through various services such as Google and Facebook. For more detail on which service might be right for you, please visit my post on online advertising. 4. Online Newsletters and Subscriptions  One great thing about having a company website with a blog is that it keeps readers interested and increases your chances of getting return customers! One good way to capitalize on this is to release a monthly newsletter to a list of subscribed customers with details on the new happenings surrounding your business. By collecting customer emails you also have a subscription list which you can use to inform them about special offers and increase your sales. 5. List your Business  in all Available Directories  Not only does listing your business in all available directories help people find it easily, it also helps your website get ranked better by Google. By directories I mean, Google Maps, Yellow Pages, Yelp, Kijijji, Craigslist, etc... By listing your business in popular places that have a high volume of web traffic you are more likely to have people find out about your business and come and check it out! By following these 5 tips you are going to see a huge increase in your customer base as well as your revenues. Luckily, I can help with all of these things for a fair and reasonable price so feel free to contact me for a completely free consultation!

item.title: Why Use Node.js?
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: In the past few weeks I have been learning Node.js, Express.js, Socket.io and Mongo DB by following Nodeschool.io tutorials as well as working on my own chat and file transer application. I decided to learn Node.js because I was reading about all the hype it was getting and wanted to find out for myself. Node.js is a non blocking event driven server-side Javascript environment which brings Javascript to the back end. With Node.js it is possible to make full front to back web apps as well as desktop apps; something which Javascript was never known for. Additionally, it is event driven or asynchronous which means that time consuming actions such as loading files from the filesystem and making I/O calls are all done in the background allowing for a faster and more fluid user experience. Node.js is completely free and open source and it comes with npm, an easy to use open source package browser where you can install additional Node.js modules such as Socket.io and Express.js. Installation of a new modules is as simple as: "npm install express". Express.js is the most popular Node.js web app framework which makes creating web apps a breeze. Socket.io is a module which allows real time event based communication accross platforms. This is especially useful for chat or file transfer apps like the one that I am building. Finally, Mongo DB is an open source NoSQL database which is exceptionally fast and is useful for social media sites and storing user data. Node.js is truly revolutionary as it brings all the advantages of Javascript to the server and desktop side to make cross platform apps. It is exceptionally fast and open source which is nice because of the wealth of packages available. It is ideally suited for projects involving: chat, file transfer, social media, video streaming, work collaboration and much more. I will continue making my chat and file transfer app and will post more updates as it nears completion!

item.title: 5 Ways to Make Your Website Rank Better
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: Many people when starting a new business setup a beautiful website and then wait for the clients to come pouring in. After a few months they realize not as many people are visiting their site as they had anticipated. Following this they often get down on themselves and start wondering why this is happening.  The reality of the matter is that most people who search for services or products do so through search engines like Google. Now Google ranks websites with a lot of visitors highly and they appear as the top search results which are also the sites to get visited by new visitors the most often. New websites without visitors rank low and they get slotted in in some far away page of the search results. The ever so important question is that if a website needs to be ranked well to get traffic and a website needs traffic to be ranked well how can this be achieved? The answer is with a lot of hard work, some money and a good deal of patience. In this article I will go over 5 things that you can do to your site to increase the number of visitors flowing in each month. Number One: Use Social Media  Social media such as: Facebook, Google +, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube,  etc... promotes your business as a brand to potential customers. Furthermore, it allows you to engage potential users by as many different channels as possible and it in turn drives more traffic towards your site.  One example of this would be getting your friends to like your Facebook page for your business and then occasionally posting articles on it to keep people in the loop about your business and to attract new customers. Another added advantage of social media is that it can be used for paid advertising. This type of advertising targets a certain audience and can drive traffic to your website or social media page based on a specified demographics outside of your friend group.   Number Two: Use Google Maps Registering a business on Google Maps not only ranks your website better on Google Search but it also allows people to see where your business is physically located and what your hours and contact info are on the most popular map app in the world. Registering a business with Google Maps is completely free, all that is required is an address of your business.   Number Three: Post to Your Site Often With Unique Content Google search rankings like sites with a lot of original content that gets updated frequently. The more original, well thought out articles you post to your site, the higher the site will be ranked and the more visitors you will get. The Google Keywords tool can be used to search popularly searched keywords for your articles. Popular widely searched keywords in articles attract more visitors especially long tail specific keywords with multiple phrases.  Posts to the site should not be too short or simple and should convey actual value to the reader so time must be taken to do a good job of writing them. One way to post often is to add a "blog" or "news" section to your site and to update it weekly or even daily.   Number Four: Optimize Your Sites Performance Sites that are friendly for mobile devices and that load quickly and have no broken links are ranked highly by Google. The Page Speed Insights tool by Google rates your website based on tests for both mobile and desktop page loading speed and reports on any possible improvements. Various CMS (Content Management System) platforms such as Wordpress have some very useful plugins for caching, SEO, and compressing images.  These plugin all help speed up the loading time of your site and result in a better ranking. Ensuring that there are no broken or dead links leading to nowhere is also important because Google wants a nice and clean website that is easy to understand. Finally, some websites benefit from having a purely mobile theme that is seperate from the desktop theme instead of using one shared mobile and desktop theme.  These websites usually load with an m at the front such as m.facebook.com. The advantage of doing this is that the mobile website can be custom designed to be simpler and to include less content to improve its readability and loading speed on mobile devices. The downside of this of course is the cost and effort involved to create a standalone mobile website.   Number Five: Post on Popular Websites and Forums If you follow a popular forum or blog with a lot of visitors that has a similar topic as you posted it is helpful to write a constructive non-spammy comment mentioning your article with a link to your site.  This is a free way of promoting yourself and your site in a high traffic area which can potentially lead to more visitors seeing your site. One thing to note though is that often times forums and blogs block links and they may spam your comment from appearing to other guests reading that particular article.   These five steps are just an idea to get you started on getting more visitors. I want to emphasize once again that there are no overnight success stories when it comes to web traffic and rankings but eventually hard work and patience does pay off.

item.title: Single Page Website With Bootstrap, Javascript, HTML and CSS
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_115" align="alignleft" width="300"] Single Page Website Project[/caption] In the past week I have been playing around with Bootstrap, Javascript, HTML and CSS and I have created a single page website project for a mock architecture company. This type of website is a perfect portfolio website piece as it showcases the services offered and the projects that have been completed by a company or an individual.  I started the project off by getting a free open source template website from: http://startbootstrap.com/template-overviews/stylish-portfolio/ [caption id="attachment_116" align="alignleft" width="300"] Portfolio Item Detail Description[/caption] I cloned the GitHub repo for that website into my local workspace and got to work modifying it to match the idea I had in mind. The website is based on a single page that contains information on the company, the services offered, the portfolio of completed projects and the contact information. The mock website contains extra pages with detailed descriptions on each service offered and each major project completed which are all accessible by clicking the portfolio items. There is also a swipe out menu that pops out from the right and takes you to the desired section of the page without having to scroll! Font Awesome Icons  are used throughout the site for pictures of the services offered. Bootstrap is used to style the frontend and for the various buttons and menus. The great thing is that this website template can be extended to any business (real estate, personal training, cooking, etc...) offering services and with portfolio items to show their potential customers their work. It's simple and elegant design allows it to engage users without losing them in complex details. To check out the mock site please visit: https://bmisljen.github.io/ If you would like a site like this for your business please do not hesitate to contact me and we can discuss an affordable rate to get you moving forward!

item.title: How to Create a Sidebar Menu With HTML, CSS, Bootstrap and JavaScript
item.dc:creator: bmisljen

item.title: Small Business Simple and Elegant Website
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_145" align="alignleft" width="300"] Simple Business Website[/caption] The Simple Business Website is a template I have created for a simple yet elegant website for small businesses such as coffee shops, small stores and barber shops. This website uses HTML5, CSS, Javascript and Bootstrap to display four simple sections to potential customers; Home, About, Blog and Contact. It is clean and responsive, fitting well on all screen sizes from desktop computers to smartphones. The home screen contains a slider with custom pictures of the business as well as a high level summary beneath it. The About page contains more detail about the business as well as the names, pictures and descriptions of staff. The Blog section contains articles posted by the business in dated order. Finally, the contact section contains a scrollable Google map iframe of the business location as well as a Contact Us form which is directly emailed to the business owner. The best thing about this site is that it is easily customized for any business and it maintains its clean and elegant responsive look. For more information on how your business can get a custom website like this for as little as $200 please contact me and we will set up a free consultation. To check out a live demo of the website please visit: https://bmisljen.github.io/Simple-Business-Website For the GitHub code: https://github.com/bmisljen/Simple-Business-Website

item.title: Power Prayer Android Prayer App
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_150" align="alignleft" width="169"] Power Prayer App[/caption] In the past week and a half I have developed an Android based prayer app for a local client from Fredericton, New Brunswick. The idea of the app is to display random biblical prayers that change when swiped. Two thumb prints appear at the bottom of the screen which when pressed display a prayer message. Prayers can also be saved to a list of favorite prayers, edited and reloaded at a later time. The app is simple, easy to use and best of all, free. It enables quick and easy prayers to be loaded on the go with no hassle. To download the app and view more screenshots please check it out at the Google Play Store.   [caption id="attachment_151" align="aligncenter" width="169"] Saving a Prayer[/caption]

item.title: Master Indian Spice Shopify Ecommerce Store
item.dc:creator: bmisljen
item.content:encoded: I have just completed a Shopify ECommerce store for a client based in Fredericton, NB for his newly launched spice business. It has truly been a great experience and I got to improve my skills with Shopify sites and the spice business as a whole. The business, (https://www.masterindianspice.com/)  called Master Indian Spice sells pre-packaged spices along with instructions to create popular, great tasting Indian dishes with ease at home. I managed to set up the store in just a few days and it is up and running and functioning well, just having received its first few orders. I truly do believe that Shopify is one of the best and easiest to use ecommerce platforms and is totally worth the money. For anyone interested in my Shopify ecommerce website solutions my rates start at $500 and I can get your site up and running in less than a week. Contact me for more details or to book a free consultation!
